alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 7:31PM CDT until April 23 at 1:36PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Titus, Red River, Franklin and Morris Counties. For the Sulphur River...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sulphur River Near Talco. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the river bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CDT Friday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and will then fall below flood stage by noon Saturday.. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.0 feet on 06/13/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1000 AM CDT.
